Lithium Hydroxide - Individual Market Analysis

CoT signals and diagnostics for Lithium Hydroxide futures.

As of Unknown

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Lithium Hydroxide CoT signal, as of 2025-11-25, indicates stability with balanced speculative and hedger positioning.
  • Current readings show no extreme positioning, and the market is in a "Normal" synthetic state.
  • Neither speculative nor hedger z-scores indicate significant stretch, remaining neutral compared to historical ranges.

Key Dynamics:

  • Speculators are net short (-35.30% OI) while hedgers are net long (36.50% OI), resulting in a "Balanced" control.
  • Positioning stretch, indicated by z-scores (-0.22 for specs, 0.11 for hedgers), is low and near neutral.
  • Recent 4-week flow shows a weak Long_Build (+0.30), suggesting minimal momentum shift.
  • No active crowding, squeeze, or exhaustion risk flags are currently present.

Macro Relevance:

  • This signal informs market sentiment and potential supply/demand dynamics within the industrial metals sector, particularly for electric vehicle production.
  • Futures positioning for commodities like Lithium Hydroxide is typically a tactical, mid-cycle signal regarding industrial demand and raw material pricing.
  • It interacts with broader macro signals related to global industrial production, trade demand, and inflation expectations from the supply side.

Data & References:

  • Lithium_Hydroxide_CoT_Signals DataFrame, latest observation 2025-11-25 [Source: Lithium_Hydroxide_CoT_Signals.html]
  • The primary drivers are `Spec_Net_%OI`, `Hedger_Net_%OI`, `Spec_zscore`, `Hedger_zscore`, and `Flow_4w`.
  • Additional public datasets that would improve depth include daily spot/futures price data for Lithium Hydroxide, and global EV production/demand forecasts.

Self-Healing

  • High-Value Inputs to Add:
    • Price data (from yfinance) for Lithium Hydroxide: Crucial for aligning positioning signals with price behavior and visual back-testing, as described in the methodology.
    • Global industrial production data for EV components: Provides fundamental context for long-term supply/demand dynamics beyond futures positioning.
  • Weaknesses in Provided Inputs:
    • No price data was included in the provided input for Lithium Hydroxide CoT signals, despite the methodology detailing its integration. Fix: Include a `Price` column aligned to `Report_Date` in the input DataFrame.
    • The `Report_Date` spans into 2025, suggesting hypothetical or future data. Fix: Clarify if these are projected dates or ensure provided dates reflect historical observations for real-time analysis.
